task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 33°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building's height, I need to see its full vertical extent from ground to roof; rotating upward will reveal the top structure necessary for height calculation.
To estimate the building's height, I need to see both the base and the top; rotating downward will reveal the ground level to establish the full vertical span from foundation to roof.

I need to see the top of the building to complete the vertical span; rotating up 90° from the current 60° down pitch will align the view to capture the roof while maintaining the building's base reference for height calculation.

Having observed both the building's roof at 85° upward pitch and previously seen the ground level, the vertical angle span suggests a height of approximately 30 meters assuming a moderate distance of 10 meters from the structure.
